fields_abstract_display: Ian Hunter discusses his time in Mott the Hoople and performs songs with James Mastro during “An Evening with Ian Hunter” on May 3, 2001 at the Rock Hall in Cleveland, OH. Topics include the band’s breakup, the hit “Suffragette City,” Hunter’s book “Diary of a Rock Star,” and his influences. Performances include “One Bitten, Twice Shy,” “Death of a Nation,” “Michael Picasso,” “Wash Us Away,” “All the Young Dudes,” and “American Spy.”
